org.chabala.brick.controllab

Interface ControlLab

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface ControlLab
extends Closeable
    Object to represent interacting with the LEGOÂ® control lab interface.

    • Method Detail

      • newControlLab

        static ControlLab newControlLab()
        Returns a new ControlLab instance.
        Returns:
        a new ControlLab instance

      • getAvailablePorts

        List<String> getAvailablePorts()
        List available serial ports on this machine. May change over time due to hot pluggable USB serial port adapters and the like.
        Returns:
        a list of system specific string identifiers for serial ports

      • open

        void open(String portName)
   throws IOException
        Opens a connection to the control lab on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        portName - system specific serial port identifier
        Throws:
        IOException - if any number of possible communication issues occurs

            throws IOException
        Stops sending power to the specified outputs.
        Parameters:
        outputs - outputs to stop
        Throws:
        IOException - if any number of possible communication issues occurs

      • turnOutputOn

        void turnOutputOn(Set<Output> outputs)
           throws IOException
        Starts sending power to the specified outputs.
        Parameters:
        outputs - outputs to start
        Throws:
        IOException - if any number of possible communication issues occurs

      • setOutputDirection

        void setOutputDirection(Direction direction,
                        Set<Output> outputs)
                 throws IOException
        Sets the Direction of the specified outputs. Direction may be changed while the outputs are powered or unpowered.
        Parameters:
        direction - desired direction
        outputs - which outputs to change
        Throws:
        IOException - if any number of possible communication issues occurs

      • setOutputPowerLevel

        void setOutputPowerLevel(PowerLevel powerLevel,
                         Set<Output> outputs)
                  throws IOException
        Sets the PowerLevel of the specified outputs. Power level may be changed while the outputs are powered or unpowered.
        Parameters:
        powerLevel - desired power level
        outputs - which outputs to change
        Throws:
        IOException - if any number of possible communication issues occurs

      • addStopButtonListener

        void addStopButtonListener(StopButtonListener listener)
        Attach a listener for StopButtonEvents.

        Multiple listeners are allowed. A listener instance will only be registered once even if it is added multiple times.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener to add

      • removeStopButtonListener

        void removeStopButtonListener(StopButtonListener listener)
        Remove a listener for StopButtonEvents.
        Parameters:
        listener - listener to remove

    throws IOException

        Specified by:
